inn1.comm: over-pitched to the extent of being a yorker, on middle and leg. Smith defends solidly
back of a length on off stump, Smith as always displays positive footwork, moves forward and defends
holds its line and comes into Smith from back of a length, outside off. He tucks it behind square on the leg side and opens his account
first hint of swing, straightens into Amla from off stump and he nudges into midwicket for one

a not so threatening away swinger, startes well outside off but Smith has a flash at it and gets an outside edge that quickly runs away backward of point. Chawla runs across from third man to field it
dangled outside off and it holds its line as it carries through nicely. Amla leaves
he begins with a very poor ball. Friendly pace, short and wide outside off, no movement. Smith bangs it away through the covers emphatically.
nice comeback from Munaf. Adjusts the line, lands this just outside off, and he gets it to nip away. Smith pokes at it from the crease and misses.
back of a length outside off and defended into the covers off the back foot
onto the pads this time, at 132 kph and Smith works it behind square for a single

and here is a scene we have seen so many times in this series. A seamer over-pitches on off stump, with several men inside the circle on the off side. And Hashim Amla unfurls the perfect cover drive that has fielders tumbling everywhere, but gives no one the chance to stop it. Four through the covers
horror start from Munaf. This one is on the pads, bonus runs for South Africa as Amla gets inside the line and gets something on it, down to fine leg for four
good line and length from Zaheer, at 130.6 kph, angles in from outside off towards Smith, who defends off the front foot. No seam movement.
Smith walks down the track as Zaheer delivers, gets across to middle and off and works a length ball towards wide mid-on

Yawn. Zaheer gets Smith. On a length outside off, perfect length from Zaheer. Smith - as has been the case so many times this summer - is not sure whether he should play back, or play forward. Or even play at it. He ends up hanging the bat outside the off stump without much conviction after getting half forward and gets a healthy edge that is heading to first slip. Until Yusuf at second slip moves quickly to his right and pouches it almost in front of Rohit's face at first.
angles across the right-hander who stays in the crease and sees it through
on the pads this time, a leg bye as van Wyk misses the nudge to the leg side
over-pitched outside off, Amla sets himself up for the flowing cover drive and mistimes it

tentative start from van Wyk. This was a good delivery from Munaf, getting it to gently nip back in from outside off. van Wyk fends off the backfoot and the ball nearly slips in through the bat-pad gap before taking the inside edge, down to fine leg for four.
this time he gets behind the line nicely and defends
and again, Munaf cuts him in half with inward seam movement. Misses the inside edge this time, and too high to hit the stumps
van Wyk is conscious to get forward this time and defend from the line of off stump
lets this one go through outside off stump, through to Dhoni. Good carry for Munaf.
fractionally short, just outside off stump and van Wyk manages to force it away square off the back foot. A couple of runs towards third man
full length from Zaheer on off stump, Amla drives crisply but straight to cover

extra bounce on this one, it was on a length around off stump and holding its line. Amla came forward into a defensive shot before being taken by surprise as it jumped up on him. Still keeps it out safely
another very full delivery on middle and off, Amla reads the length nicely and drives to mid off

not the most controlled shot. Zaheer gives Amla the width, tempting him into the square drive and Amla goes for it though it's too wide for him to play along the ground. It flew away to the left of a completely horizontal Kohli at point and went for four

completely in control this time. Drop in pace from Zaheer, slower ball gone awry. 117 kph, overpitched on off and Amla reads the length and pace well in time to move the front foot across and cream it along the ground through the covers
shorter outside off from round the wicket for the final delivery, Amla steers it backward of point and this time Kohli tumbles and cuts it off
more nip from Munaf, gets one to go away this time from the right hander. Amla watches closely and lets it go
on a length around off stump, Amla check-drives compactly into the covers
drops this one on the pads and Amla cashes in with an efficient nudge  behind square leg for a couple
134 kph, just short of good length, but Amla is looking ominous now. Drives nicely on the up, but straught to Kohli at point
a fuller length this time, Amla comes forward and defends into the off side
good line, very close to off stump and short of a length. Amla goes back in the crease and defends it when it is beside him.
Zaheer lets van Wyk rotate the strike with a ball on the pads which is calmly dropped past short midwicket for a single
too much width here. Amla would have hit that away even if it wasn't this wide outside off. Gets forward and across, and then cuts it away square between point and third man
better line from Zaheer, again returning to round the wicket, Amla doesn't have the room to work with and forces it into the on side
135 kph, back of a length outside off, Amla is at least a yard down the track and outside off when he makes contact with it. Defended into the off side, eventually, it wasn't there for the drive
stays back this time does Amla, keeps Zaheer guessing about the footwork, and punches into the covers.
comes in from wide of the crease, Amla works it off the pads but straight to midwicket
electric from Kohli. Poor ball from Munaf, short, wide and asking to be smashed square. van Wyk has enough time to play it in front of point. Kohli was quick, dived across to his right and cut it off
better line this time, no room for van Wyk to set himself up for the horizontal bat shot. He defends quietly to the off side

far better delivery from Munaf. Short of a length outside off and it gets big on van Wyk who looks to force a cut shot off a delivery too close to the body. Misses the outside edge, though not by much
van Wyk camps on the back foot and steers a delivery outside off through square for a single
back of a length on off stump, Amla gives it the respect it deserves with compact defence into the off side
and now he plays the flourishy on-the-up cover drive and times it perfectly. Rohit moved quickly at short cover to stop it
a harsh return to ODI cricket for Chawla, and he has himself to blame. No sweeper cover in place and he drops one short, van Wyk rocks back and it cuts away with the spin.
short again, but not so wide. van Wyk's cut goes straight to cover
the wrong 'un, wraps him on the pad in front of leg stump as he looks to nudge it square. Polite appeal, turned down
short of a length again, close to off stump and he has some turn going here. van Wyk looks to cut again, but it zips past the outside edge
on the pads this time, van Wyk looks to nudge it round the corner, but short fine leg stops it
again on the pads, this time it is worked through midwicket for a single

brave shot from van Wyk and he executes perfectly. This was well outside off, not the ideal line for the lap shot, but van Wky set himself up well, moving the front foot across and lapping him almost all the way over square leg

well bowled, Munaf replies with an effort ball, 135.5 kph and lifting extra from back of a length. van Wyk looks to force the cut shot away, and it whizzes past the outside edge. van Wyk and Munaf share a thought!
connects with the cut this time, but there are three men very square on the off side. He can't find the gap
closer to the stumps, van Wyk plays with a strraight bat this time. Defends it towards cover point

that's another rare shot from van Wyk's repertoire and again, mighty effective. Short again from Munaf, not much width and the conventional cut would have taken it straight to the cordon. So he intentionally angles the bat at the point of contact, with the face of the bat facing upwards as he cracks it over the infield and in front of square.
finishes with a defensive shot towards the covers again. Eventful over that.
tossed up on leg stump, Amla on-drives wide of mid on for a single
flighted again, on middle stump and van Wyk sets himself up for the slog sweep. Can't quite time the shot, and gets a single
Amla goes back in the crease and dabs a short ball turning away towards point for one

van Wyk means business here. Full ball on off stump, turning away, van Wyk doesn't give it any respect, and just drop-kicks it over the bowler's head for four down the ground. Solid and comprehensive.
tossed up again on off, van Wyk drives straight to cover
finishes with a sharp wrong 'un that zips in quickly. van Wyk did not pick it, but it was turning well down the leg side when it hit the pad
flighted on off, Amla gets across and works it with the wrists, square for a single
back of a length on off stump and turning in, van Wyk defends down the track
huge spin back into van Wyk. He slowed that up, landed it just outside off and it kept coming back into van Wyk who aborted the attempt to cut and just dabbed it behind point for one
Amla shuffles across to off stump and works a delivery turning in from off and middle towards square leg
van Wyk goes down on a knee and sweeps him just behind square leg for one more
tossed up on off again to end the over, Amla drives calmly through mid on. Five singles, came too easily, in that over
slides the first one down the leg side as Amla misses the glance. Dhoni whips the bails off, and it is a wide
on middle and off, Amla reaches out and works it to the leg side
Amla plays into the covers and gets a single
that seemed to hold its line around off stump, van Wyk came forward and defended back down the track
van Wyk works a back of length delivery turning into him in front of square leg for one
Amla skips out, gets to the pitch of an offie outside off and drives against the spin wide of mid off for a single
short and wide enough outside off for the cut, but van Wyk fails to connect
flighted on off, Amla advances and gets to the pitch. Drives it solidly, but straight to mid on
short ball, turns into Amla's body and he works it off the hips behind square for one
straightens from off stump, van Wyk gets beside the line and cuts nicely behind square for one
tossed up on off, Amla gets the front foot across and works it straight to mid on
this one is straighter, allows Amla to whip it square for a single
drags this one miles short, but he has deep midwicket and deep square leg to get away with it. van Wyk pulls in between the two fielders for a couple
tight on off stump from Yusuf, Amla plays it straight to extra cover
works this one with the spin behind square for a single

more innovation from van Wyk, he's been really enterprising today. Short of a length around off stump, van Wyk knows there are gaps deep on the off side, so he cuts it away in the air, over the covers for four. Could have easily slog swept that, but he knows where the gaps are.
chips this one in the air on purpose, lofting down to long on for one more
Amla nurdles one fine, but not fine enough to beat short fine leg
flighted on off to end the over, Amla works it with the spin to mid on
turns in sharply again from outside off, van Wyk gets forward to deal with the spin and defends
shorter outside off, van Wyk dabs it nicely, but straight to backward point
signs of a slowing pitch. van Wyk nearly chips a flighted ball on off back to Bhajji
drops slightly short again, van Wyk is quick and decisive with the feet, goes back in the crease and cuts softly towards point for one
Amla charges out, takes a tossed up ball on the full and drives through the covers
van Wyk ends the over by check-driving with the spin straight to midwicket
flighted but wide outside off, Amla cuts away in front of square for a single
turns away from wide outside off again, van Wyk cuts with the spin for one more
flighted on off, and Amla unfurls that lovely extra cover drive. There is protection in the deep, so just a single
back of a length and straightening from off, van Wyk defends to the off side
van Wyk is charging out, Yuvraj holds the length back, the batsman adjusts and cuts away square for one more
flighted outside off again, driven along the ground to long off for another single. South Africa are chugging along without a concern. India's spin tactics haven't worked until now.
flighted on leg and straightening. Defended down the track
Amla skips out, gets to the pitch and drives straight to cover
too short, Amla cuts it away straight past a rare fumble from Kohli. There is protection in the deep
van Wyk plays the on drive to long on,
was that the wrong 'un? Amla went for a loose drive from outside off and got the inside edge that ran away safely behind square leg

here comes the boundary ball, and van Wyk is ready. Short and wide, turning away as well, giving the batsman all the room he wants. van Wyk says thank you and cracks it past the two men standing square on the off side
Amla forces one from off stump into the covers for one more
flighted on off, driven back straight to Yuvraj
van Wyk drives with the spin through extra cover for another single
Amla skips out, Yuvraj holds the length back and gets it to spin away, Amla covers the line and works it against the spin through midwicket
edged, but safe. Yuvraj sucks van Wyk into the drive, and gets extra spon outside off to take the outside edge, that flew just past a diving Yusuf at first slip.
punches the last ball solidly but towards mid off.
full on leg stump, tapped with the spin to the off side for a single and that is a very good fifty for van Wyk.
tossed up on off, driven on the up, but straight to cover
this time he uses the wrists and the feet to find the gap. Past the infield for a single to deep cover
short of leg stump and straightening, van Wyk works it off the back foot through square leg for one
googly, Amla did not pick it as he shaped to cut the short ball. He had to quickly adjust and then cross-batted it away to mid on in a hurry
dances down the pitch this time, gets to the pitch of the ball and drives a single towards long off
tight sing.le, van Wyk slides in with a desperate dive. Cut away towards Harbhajan at point, whose throw did not miss by much as Dhoni tried to parry it onto the stumps.
flighted on off, drives it straight to mid off
golly, thats a violent cut. He smashed it with a vengeance. Short, wide and turning away, its a routine that's played out too often today. van Wyk absolutely brutalised it through the covers
on the pads, he looks for the paddle-dab fine, but finds short fine leg
slows it up through the air, on middle and leg and van Wyk is early on the forward defensive. It pops up down the track, but lands safely
leggie, turning away from off, Amla drives after shuffling across, with the spin towards wide long on for one
van Wyk mistimes a loft down the ground so badly that it barely crosses the circle. A single down the ground as long on runs in
short outside off, Amla looks to cut and finds the fielder. van Wyk wants an impossible single, but sense prevails
Amla moves across to off stump and works it against the spin towards midwicket for one
van Wyk is so tired of cutting for fours, he decides to let one go outside off
full on the stumps, safely defended back to the bowler
Amla gets across to off stump and works a single to the leg side

Yuvraj plucks an apple out of nowhere! The best part of the catch was how easy he made it look. Tossed up on off stump, van Wyk packs a punch in his straight drive, and thinks he can get it easily down the ground. Yuvraj seemed to say, "Talk to the hand". Left hand to be specific. He just puts the left hand out and holds a ball that was traveling at some pace. Easy does it.
works the first ball through the covers to get going
Amla comes down again, gets to the pitch and drives past mid on for another single
ooh, turns one past the outside edge. Lands on a length outside off and straightens past AB who plays tentatively inside the line
poor ball to end the over and AB is ready. Short and wide, spinning away, AB adjusts the cut shot, playing it late and with an open face to get it past Harbhajan at backward point. Four more.
drives the first ball down the ground for one
drops another legspinner infuriatingly short outside off, AB cuts with the spin towards deep point for one
Amla charges out, and gets too close to the pitch of the ball. Digs it back towards the bowler
short again, Amla lets it go unpunished, cutting it straight to backward point for one
and now on the pads, full toss, easily driven through wide mid on for one
too close to off stump for the cut, AB doesn't make contact
back of a length on middle and straightening, Amla slaps down to long on for one more
whoa, what happened there? AB charges out and looks for the inside out extra cover drive. He makes feeble contact and nearly holes out off the outside half. It goes over the infield for a couple
opens the face this time and guides him off the face for a single
incredibly acrobatic from Raina. Amla skips out and times a cover drive ominously, but an hortizontal Raina somehow stops it
and again! Amla can't get it past him with another well-timed cover drive as Raina tumbles across. That's atleast six runs saved in two balls
works the final ball, off the middle and leg line, back to Yuvraj
flighted on off, AB drives with the spin through cover-point for one
skids through from outside off stump, Amla looks to cut but can't find the gap. That hurried on to him
another skidder from wide of the crease, Amla plays a very late cut towards backward point for one.
fired in at 90 kph on leg stump, AB plays it back to the bowler
chipped in the air, on purpose, short of Harbhajan at long off. Flighted on off, and played well, with the turn
another one that holds its line as it comes in from outside off, Amla is kept waiting for the half-century. Forces it into the covers, but can't get the gap

Yuvraj has made AB look rather ordinary with a lovely bit of spin. It's the same thing that happened in the previous game, though then, AB was wrongly given caught behind as he lunged out. This time he is comprehensively stumped,. Slow through the air, dipping on middle and leg, and breaking away menacingly. AB was lulled into skipping down the track, fooled by the flight, and was then groping in hope as it turned past him. Dhoni had a year to break the stumps.
JP defends the first ball from off stump towards the off side

huge appeal and JP gets away with it. Very full on middle and straightening into JP who looks to sweep. He misses and it would have hit off stump. Umpire Taufel said no. Agonisingly long appeal from Yuvraj and Dhoni goes waste.
this one is on the toes and JP works it square for one
Amla reaches yet another fifty, with another chip to the leg side after getting across to off stump.
JP comes down the track and works it off the pads through square leg for one
tossed up on off, Duminy defends off the front foot
shorter on offf stump, stays back and drives through mid off for one
turns in from outswide off, Amla works it with the spin but straight to mid on
gets it away for a run this time, worked with the spin past mid on
very edgy from Duminy, goes for an expansive drive without reading the length or the spin. Inside edges it behind square leg for one
Amla comes out again, gets to the flight and drives down the ground for one
Amla works him from middle and leg to the on side, Yuvraj moves across to field it
too wide outside off and called a wide
closer to off stump, Amla punches off the back foot for a single
over-pitched on off, JP drives back carefully to the bowler
drops this short outside off and JP cuts into the covers for one
Amla motions across the stumps and works him very softly wide of mid-on. Very good batting this, he picks up two as the outfielders run in to field it.
flighted outside off and Amla drives with the spin straight to deep cover
full on the pads, Amla drives through mid on for another single
JP comes out and works Bhajji from the pads straight to midwicket
JP steers him square for another single
Amla hangs back in the crease and works him square. India leaking singles.
too short outside off, easy cut for JP who sends it to deep cover
Amla skips out, gets to the pitch and drives against the spin to long off for one
flighted on off, Amla unfurls another inside out drive through extra cover. And another single
flighted on off, JP drives with the spin through wide mid on for one
Amla has tonked a rare short delivery from Yuvraj. Apart from being a half-tracker, it was on middle and leg, Amla went back in the crease and played a big pull shot, one bounce over midwicket
more air this time, Amla comes out of the crease and drives to mid off
and short this time, Amla cuts it away square. Rohit does well in the sweeper cover area, tumbling across to his left to save the boundary
flighted again on off, Amla punches with the spin towards mid off
Amla moves across the stumps and works it square, but can't find the gap
tossed up on off stump and Amla drives it with pleasing poise through extra cover
short and wide outside off, JP cuts it easily to the deep for another single. Too easy.
flighted on off, Amla times the straight drive well, but Harbhajan intervenes after moving quickly to the right. "Well done, Bhaj," says Dhoni.
flighted outside off this time, Amla works it with the spin through mid on
tossed up outside off, JP times the cover drive well, but on the bounce to Raina in the circle
tossed up on off, Amla easily chips it past the bowler for one to long on
goes back in the crease and punches from middle and leg through wide mid on.
Amla looks to steer-cut and misses as the ball keeps low outside off
12th man Ashwin has dropped an easy catch at square leg. Short and turning down the leg, it was there for the pull. Amla savaged it, but straight to Ashwin, who seemed to pick it late.
plays with the turn towards point for one
Amla drives past wide mid on for another single
tossed up on middle, Amla drives straight to mid on
Harbhajan drops short, just outside off and Amla happily puts it through the vacant third man area with the latest of late cuts. Delicate.
flighted on middle again, Amla drives down the ground for another single
JP cuts from close to off stump and can't find the gap. Straight to point, for no run
this time JP gets the single, dabbing softly towards cover
Amla works him with the spin back down the track and Harbhajan tidies up
short and wide enough for another cut from JP. Another single
Amla charges out again, gets to the pitch and drives past a diving cover fielder. There is cover in the deep and they get a single
JP skips out now, gets to the pitch and drives down the ground for a single
Amla works him with the spin off the backfoot, through midwicket for another single
JP works it off the pads towards midwicket for another single

and Amla ends the over with another boundary. India are falling apart here. Short delivery from Rohit, it spun in sharply. Amla realised he could not cut, but he had a plan B. He waited for it to come in and then cut it away late with an angled face past Harbhajan at short third man. Four more.
tossed up on middle and leg, JP opens the face and steers, but finds point
short this time outside off, JP looks to cut but can't middle it
skips down the track and across to get to the off side of the ball and then work it off the toes for one through midwicket
Amla drives another single past Harbhajan
JP comes forward and opens the face as he check-drives, but can't find the gap
Bhajji promptly drops short, and JP guides it square for another single
tails into JP's pads at 127.8 kph and it is worked square for a single
on Amla's pads from round the wicket and he easily works him square with a flick for one
back of a length, angling across JP who looks to steer it square, but can't get it away
JP hops across to middle and off and then clips Zaheer square for another single
back of a length on off stump, Amla taps it off the backfoot behind point for a single
and he ends the over with a nicely-timed cut past point. Quick work in the deep keeps it to two
Amla works him with the spin through square leg for one
JP goes back in the crease and tucks him behind square leg
this time he plays the shot fine enough to get the single
Amla flicks with the spin for another single, this time to midwicket
Raina stops at the point of delivery and then tosses it up on the toes. JP works him through midwicket for one more
back of a length on the stumps, JP stays back and runs him off the opened face towards third man for one
Amla jumps across well outside off, Zaheer targets the pads and Amla gets into a tangle as he looks to flick and gets a leading edge behind square on the off side
angling into the pads from wide of the crease, JP works him square for one more
Amla drives through the covers, on the up as Zaheer lands one on a length outside off. It is fielded by the man in the deep, but two runs to Amla
Zaheer bowls a horror wide down the leg side. Dhoni does well to dive across full length and stop it

Amla hardly needs luck the way he is going, but when it comes he will take it. Zaheer gets this to move away a bit from leg stump line and Amla plays inside the line. He gets an outside edge that flies fine and for four through third man
Zaheer produces a good yorker on the toes and Amla does well to dig it out for one towards mid on

great grace from Amla. He's reached a fine 100, and what a shot to bring it up. He waits for Raina to spin one back into him, and works it almost off Dhoni's gloves for four through third man. He's running them fine and he's running India ragged here.
works this one with the spin to long on for one
JP turns it around with another streer through point for one
slips down the leg side and is called wide
Amla stays back in the crease and guides square for another single
short on off stump to end the over, and JP slaps it past the bowler to his left for another single
back of a length outside off, JP steers through third man for one more
over-pitched on middle and leg, Amla clips it off the pads for yet another single
full outside off, JP drives to Zaheer at long off for another single. SA will be thinking of that batting PP now. With some trepidation - it has not been kingf to them so far this series.
full on Amla's off stump and he drives past extra cover for one more
over-pitched outside off and driven fluently towards deep cover for one more
single to third man off a slower ball to end the over
back of a length anf coming into Amla who slips it square for one
huge wide down the leg side as Zaheer bowls from over the wicket
this time on the pads, JP works it square for one
short ball on middle, Amla sets himself for the pull but mistimes the shot. Still gets a couple towards midwicket
Amla moves across outside off and clips this through midwicket for two more.
over-pitched on off and Amla cracks another cover drive. This time, Raina is in the way
angled into the pads from wide of the crease, Amla somehow gets it out to mid off for one
full on off stump, Amla opens the face and picks a single through cover point
and JP has a boundary at long last. Nothing half-volley outside off, JP steers it nicely through the covers for four. SA on the offensive

and gone. Munaf hits back. He holds the length back and keeps it on off stump, JP looks to pull and skies a top edge. Munaf recovers well on his follow through, moves to the left of the pitch around the non-striker's end and takes the catch.
nice tight line, on middle and leg, Amla can't do much with it
and now a smart legcutter from Munaf, it stops, grips and goes away from Amla who does well to dab it to the off side for one
Faf is away, tapping a ball on his pads towards mid on for a single
angles in from wide of the crease, on the pads and Faf tucks it through midwicket for one more
SA losing crucial momentum here. Zaheer keeps it on a length and it comes into Amla who looks to pull and doesn't connect.
slower ball from Zaheer, comes into Amla from outside off and cuts him in half as he tries to play to the leg side. Gets it away for a single to the off side
Faf jumps out of the crease, it is back of a length outside off and he manages to under-edge it behind point for one
136.6 kph, tight line coming into Amla again, and he misses to time the drive. Another single to the off side
Faf charges out and gets a ball tailing into his pads. He looks to heave it away, but under-edges it to midwicket for a quick single. Powerplays are done.

and a four off the first ball after the batting PP. There is no third man in place, and Faf manages to get a thick edge to a decentish delivery on off stump that was not there for the drive. Four more.

Faf has been Munaf-ed. Adjusts his line, knowing that Faf will look for the off side again, ramrod straight, without drifting on to the pads. Faf charged out, but could not have played any proper shot to that one. He's tried to work it to the off side, but the ball slips past at 135.5 kph and middle stump is out of the ground.
and gets a double to start off. Another good delivery from Munaf, no room outside off for the cut and not full enough for the drive. and Botha steered it past point and got two.

Munaf is throwing a humongous spanner in South Africa's works here. Another wicket goes down and this is exceptionally smart bowling. Barring the one ball that JP drove through the covers, there's been nothing to drive. This was another delivery back of a length in line with the stumps and Botha had to manufacture a shot. He looked to get forward, and then tried to force the pull, despite not having the room or the length for the shot. He got a top-edge, and Dhoni ran back to collect it.
Amla gets another one on the off stump and quietly drops it to the off side for one.
Nice shot from Petersen, he's slammed one through the covers as Munaf bowls it full and wide and it is four more.
Amla takes SA past 250 with an off drive to a very full ball outside off.

and India have another one in the end overs. Zaheer delivers the inch-perfect yorker from over the stumps. It was always headed for the base of off stump. Robin backed away, made room and looked to squeeze it away through the off side, but there was no stopping this one. Off stump goes for a walk.

Steyn is run out. He chips out of the crease, making room on the off side as he does. Zaheer sees him and follows him, leaving Steyn with no room to play it to the off side. It is through him and Dhoni collects. Steyn tries to steal a single and turn the strike over to Amla, before realising there is no chance for a run. Dhoni runs towards the stumps and throws them down. Five down since resumption.
another yorker, this one is just outside off as the batsman backs away again to the leg side. He ends up leaving it.

South Africa have lost the plot. And don't even seem to know it. Morne misses another yorker outside off, and then runs out of his crease mindlessly. Dhoni collects again and throws the stumps down. You miss, you run, I hit - seems to be the routine.

No! Lopsy plays it out, as he would if he were the nightwatchman playing for stumps. Not a bad idea, its better than throwing your wicket away. Full toss on off stump, he gets behind it and defends to the off side. Zaheer stops the ball. Amla played only two balls in the last four overs!

inn2.comm: length ball, pacy outside off, Parthiv reaches across and leaves
ooh, this one darted in from off stump at 136.4 kph. Parthiv had to quickly pull the bat down to play it away to the leg side, off the inside edge
Parthiv gets behind the line around off stump and defends solidly towards mid off
Parthiv mistimes the punch through the covers, finds the fielder
back of a length on off stump, he gets forward to it and plays it back down the track

Parthiv is away, nice clip off the pads, though played uppishly. It was short of a length again, around middle and leg and he managed to get the timing off the back foot. Some manic running gets him three.

Parthiv crunches him away square. That's where he likes it - short and wide outside off. Parthiv waits for it and cracks it away, through the gap behind point, and he did not bother to keep it along the ground
this time Lopsy lands this on the pads and Parthiv works it square for another single
Rohit lets a ball angling across him outside off go through to the keeper
holds the length back, pushes Rohit back into the crease and he defends to the off side
bangs a bouncer too short, and it is called a wide
fuller on off, draws him forward into the drive and Rohit plays softly towards cover point
majestic from Rohit. Lopsy dangles this too wide outside off, giving him enough room to swing the arms and Rohit obliges with a flowing square drive.
pacy delivery, whizzes past outside Parthiv's off stump and he has a huge flash at it. But he misses.

this is really good batting from the little man. Steyn gives him just a hint of room outside off stump and Parthiv is ready with another emphatic square-punch off the back foot., The placement was perfect - past point and square enough to beat third man
even wider outside off and Parthiv has another violent go at it, and misses.

Steyn hustles him with a bouncer, but Parthiv refuses to be hustled. He goes for the pull, is late on the shot, but manages to get it just past mid on for a couple down the ground., Uppish, but just safe
boy, was that fast! Furious bouncer from Steyn, must have been close to a wide, Parthiv let it go and the AB took off vertically to haul that in.
slower ball to end the over, Parthiv sees it early and opens the face to drop it to the off side. No single though
another ominous cover drive from Rohit, but this time straight to the fielder. over-pitched outside off from Lopsy and he moved into it nicely.
holds the length back, Rohit stays on the crease and defends to the off side
even shorter, and ends up in line with off stump at 131 kph. Rohit rides the bounce and steers it behind point for a single
looks to cut a slowish ball outside off, but can't make contact.
into Parthiv's pads at 132 kph and he flicks towards midwicket for a single

And Rohit falls. Frustrating, as he has been through this series. Lopsy angles another one across him and Rohit goes for another expansive cover drive. Unlike the previous shot, he does not move his feet across. The result - a thick inside edge that crashes into the stumps.
short and a touch wide outside off, Parthiv responds with another crisp cut shot and it races away for a single to third man
144 kph, fierce lifter outside off to welcome Kohli to the crease. That landed back of a length outside off and reared up like a monster. Kohli wasn't playing a shot.

appeal for run out, but Kohli has just made it. Gets forward and drops a ball towards point for a quick single. The throw misses the stumps, and Morne van Wyk doesn't have enough time to gather and break the stumps before he gets in
short of a length outside off, Parthiv lets it go for a change
Parthiv drives on the up, uppishly, but it lands just short of mid off. Length ball at good pace outside off and he goes after it, but can't get it past the fielder
into the pads this time and Parthiv works it through midwicket for a single
back of a length outside off and Parthiv thinks of flashing at it, but leaves
and now a bouncer, goes well down the leg side, and high. Wide on both counts
back of a length and into Parthiv's body, he moves slightly across and clips it behind square for a single

how lucky is Kohli to get away with that? Back of a length, harmless ball on middle and leg, he looks to work it square, but is early on the shot. He gets a leading edge that ballooned up on the off side. Botha tried to sprint in from short cover but slipped. No one else could get there in time. JP tried from point, but couldn't
fuller on off stump, Kohli is into the off drive, but finds mid off
Kohli steers square, JP is electric as always, diving away like a mongoose on steroids at point to stop that. He didn't gather it soon enough, else a run out might have been on
Parthiv rolls on, smart work once again. He gets one slightly short outside off, not there for the cut this time, and he opens the face to run it fine for four through third man.

A rare failure for Virat Kohli. Morne does him with sheer pace. Back of a length and extra bounce from outside off, Kohli committed to the check-drive into the covers early. On second thoughts, he may have wanted to leave it. It is through him in a jiffy, taking the outside edge through to the keeper
homes in on the perfect length outside off at 142 kph, Dhoni does what Kohli may have preferred to do. Leaves it outside off.
another leave outside off as Morne keeps getting extra bounce outside off
this one comes in from wide of the crease, at 141 kph and Dhoni just manages to play it away to the leg side before it hits his pads. He's away
into Parthiv's pads, he looks to flick but can't time the shot too well
Parthiv's timing them like a dream. Short and wide outside off, he jumps into position and cracks it away in front of point for four more
slowish ball on middle and leg, Dhoni comes down the track and then can't play any shot so defends to the leg side
and now he goes for an almighty whiplash over backward point. Short ball from Lopsy, was there for the shot, but Dhoni could not connect as it went through at 133 kph
Dhoni lets one go outside off.

Dhoni gets the timing on the backfoot punch. It is just outside off, and not full enough for the drive, Dhoni makes it count with quick hands. His hands moved in a quick whirr to send it hurrying through the covers
and tries the same shot off the last ball. He can't time it this time.

Parthiv of course is showing why he is playing as a specialist batsman. Another superb piece of timing. Morne drifts onto the pads, and Parthiv clips him with a pleasing flourish through square leg. He has looked in NO trouble.
angling across him this time, back of a length and Parthiv steers it quietly for a single through point

India have lost a huge wicket. The scorecard will say edged and caught at slip, but this was not an outside edge in the true sense of the word. It was short, fractionally outside off and Dhoni went for the cut. He was a little late on the shot, and it wasn't wide enough for the cut. Plus it bounced more than he anticipated. Hence the edge, it was dying on first slip who took it well. India are reeling here.
he clips his first ball off the pads, straight to midwicket.
Yuvi is away with an outside edge wide of the slips. Full and there for the drive, he was late on the shot and the outside edge flew harmlessly through to third man.
tight line from round the wicket, tucks up Yuvraj with one that comes in from outside off. Yuvraj defends off the back foot
Parthiv gets one outside the off stump and once again dabs it to third man without a fuss for a single
back of a length on off stump to Yuvraj, who drives off the back foot into the covers
stays back in the crease again and Yuvraj plays it into the covers. Still no run
another pacy bouncer! Yuvraj had to move his head out of the way in a hurry. That seemed destined to hit his head. Boy, that was fast, at 140.8 kph

that's uppish and just past Morne at third man. Yuvraj looks for the upper cut and times it almost too well. Morne ran in a few metres and tried to reach it, but it bounced just in front and went away for four
shortens the length, Yuvraj stays in the crease and defends into the covers
145.5 kph, hustles Parthiv with pace as he looks to clip it square. They think of a single, but Morne cleans up quickly
short of a length outside off, Parthiv advances into the punch. He finds mid off
Parthiv has a good piece of wood in his hands. Morne over-pitches on his pads, Parthiv gets inside the line and times the flick so well it almost goes all the way for six.

and now a corker through the covers! Over-pitched again, this time outside off and Parthiv leans forward to smoke the covers off that one. Robin Peterson does exceptionally, running across from deep point to slide and save that.
lets this one go outside off as Morne holds the length back a touch.

du Plessis seems to have taken a very good catch at covers. But they are checking upstairs. This could be interesting. Here's what happened: Driving length again from Morne, Parthiv gives it the treatment with another cover drive, but this time it is slightly airy. Faf at cover dives across to his left, tries to take it with both hands, with the right hand over the left. As he lands, the left hand comes off after he pouched it, and his right hand took full control of the ball. Did the ball touch the ground as he landed? Replays seem a little dicey - he did have two fingers under the ball in the end. The third umpire gives it out. Parthiv's blinder comes to an end.
back of a length on off stump, Yuvraj defends off the back foot to the off side
short again from Steyn, at 140 kph, and Yuvraj opens the face to play it square
this whizzes past Yuvraj's off stump in a jiffy. He goes for the flash outside off and misses as it flies past at good pace
back of a length again on the stumps, Yuvraj defends off the back foot once again
looks to make room outside off and manufacture a shot outside off, but can't find the gap

Yuvraj plays one of the most ordinary shots you will see. Short, slower ball at 120 kph, lifting at him outside off, no room for the cut and Yuvraj goes at it with a half-hearted half-cut, half-steer nothing shot and guides it straight to point. It wasn't timed well enough to rush past the fielder, or placed wide enough to beat him. India's challenge is coming to an end.
Raina stays back in the crease and works it off the pads towards the leg side.
back of a length outside off and Yusuf lets it go
play and a miss. 143 kph and it flies past the outside edge as Yusuf has a poke without moving his feet
comes in with the angle from outside off and Yusuf works it off the pads towards the leg side for one

Robin Peterson is on fire at deep point! He's saved another four with a brilling run and a dive at the cover boundary. Over-pitched across Raina who eases into the cover drive and times it exquisitely. It seemed destined for the boundary, but Robin had other plans.

Raina has smashed that. He hasn't got too many full deliveries to start off, so far in SA. But Morne has given him a couple here. Over-pitched on off, Raina drives it straight to the left of mid off and picks four.
back of a length on off stump, Yusuf hangs back and works it square for a single

Raina gets one fractionally short of a length outside off and looks tentative as he tries to guide it through the off side. It is past him in a flash. It's a no-ball for not having enough fielders inside the circle for a Powerplay over.
Stayn pushes him back with another short ball, 145 kph, Raina gets behind it and defends
stays back again and opens his face to guide a short ball towards point
lovely control on that pull shot from Raina. Short ball, aimed at the body and Raina swivelled well to get into position and pull it square for four

Oh, Raina. Another wicket gifted. Raina looks to upper cut over third man now. That was lifting outside off, and there was a deep third man in place. Raina couldn't have found the fielder with more precision if he was aiming for him. Well, at this rate, India might be bowled out before 20 overs. And yes, that will constitute a match!
and gets a nasty bouncer first up. He weaves away in a hurry as it whizzes by
back of a length, Yusuf hangs back and defends from the line of off stump
Yusuf plays the upper cut now. And surprise, surprise, there is no one to catch it at deep backward point. Well controlled, and well placed. That's been a rarity so far this Indian innings.
another short ball, Yusuf stays beside the line and taps it square on the off side for one
full, on the stumps, Harbhajan defends cautiously to the leg side for one run
back of a length at 135 kph, close to the body and Yusuf cuts it without timing to point
slower ball on the stumps and it kept low to make matters worse. Yusuf just about covered the line and defended off the back foot
turns the first ball into Harbhajan, who works it square for one
Yusuf defends a straight ball on off stump
moves across with the front foot and works him square on the leg side for a single
flighted outside off and Bhajji drives into the covers for one
tossed up and turning in, Yusuf defends to the leg side
and finishes the over with a single to retain strike. Worked with the spin towards square leg for one
turns away first up, as Yusuf prods iff the front foot. Not far from the outside edge
looks to sweep, but is beaten by the turn again
stays back and forces this one against the spin through midwicket for one
flighted outside off and Harbhajan nearly scoops it to point as he looks to drive off the front foot
turns away from off stump, Bhajji covers the spin this time and defends
smashed. Tossed up on off stump and Harbhajan goes down on a knee and flat-bats over long on for six.
back of a length outside off, Yusuf stays back in the crease and steers square for one
holds its line outside off, Harbhajan watches closely and defends
jumps out of the crease and drives along the ground towards long off
Yusuf gets inside the line and works it off the pads for a single through square leg
short of a length, Harbhajan goes back and defends down the track
very close call for lbw, but Harbhajan surives. Looks to sweep a flat straight ball that seemed to be headed for the stumps and misses. It might have hit him outside the line of off
Yusuf moves across to off stump and sweeps along the ground to deep square leg
looks to sweep again from leg stump, and makes contact with the paddle. Straight to short fine leg.
he seems too eager to play the paddle, and again it is stopped by short fine leg
skips out, gets to the pitch and chips him down the ground for a couple before long off comes across
again jumps out of the crease and drags it down to wide long on for a single
Yusuf shuffles across and works one off the pads to short fine leg

Harbhajan perishes. Another soft dismissal to a nothing shot. Tossed up on middle and leg and he chips it straight to midwicket in the circle. SA are five balls away from getting their hands on the prize. India can still make the early evening flight back home. Even South Africa can't choke from here.
tossed up on leg, he works it fine, but can't get the gap.
looks to guide him through the off side this time, but can't get the single away
flatter ball on off stump, Chawla spots the lack of spin and defends
another one aiming for the pads, full and fast, Chawla manages to get it away square for a tight single this time
tossed up on middle and leg, Yusuf drives to long on. The series will not be shared. 20 overs completed.
tossed up on middle and leg, clipped away through midwicket for a couple

Yusuf picks up four through square leg, very close to umpire Jerling standing square, and too fast for Steyn from fine leg to cut it off. Peterson is not happy. Not everyone can field like him! Nice, well-timed sweep.
looks to sweep again, but is early on the shot and beaten by the extra spin.

whoa, how strange was that? Yusuf gets ready for the reverse sweep and gets into a good position, but it is very well and he ends up having to shovel it high, even as he tumbles at the crease. And the ball clears the boundary behind backward point!
flighted on off, Yusuf defends to the off side of the pitch
huge appeal for lbw turned down. That seemed to hit too high as Yusuf got forward and looked to defend
straightens from off stump, Piyush opens the face and steers it to point
full on off and middle, faster through the air, Piyush just manages to bring the bat down on it
advances down the track and digs it out towards long on for one
straighter one outside off, Yusuf adjusts to the lack of turn and opens the face, but can't get it past short third man
turn and bite into a bemused Yusuf who pulls out of his attempted late dab towards third man
fired in fast on middle and leg, Yusuf plays it back towards the bowler
tossed up on off, Piyush defends solidly
Piyush chips out and gets to the pitch, and slams it through the covers for four. Nice shot, had it under control all the time.
now he stays back in the crease and plays a late dab towards third man. Couple more to Piyush

Piyush was supposed to make the tail shorter. Well, he has contributed seven runs to the cause. Robin has turned one in sharply, past his forward defensive prod and off bail falls off. India are eight down.
tossed up and turning away, Zaheer defends to the off side.
on the pads this time, he defends with a closed face to the leg side
turning down the leg side, nudged with the spin for a single to deep square leg
Zaheer comes across and defends to the off side
extra bounce, that jumped up from back of a length and Zaheer did well to adjust and defend as he took the top hand off
Zaheer plays with an opened face as he gets one that holds it line outside off
and more defense to end the over. On the front foot and defended to the off side
he begins with a friendly half-tracker. Yusuf rocks back in a trice and brutalises it over midwicket with a comprehensive pull shot
short again, turning away from Yusuf who cuts it for a single into the covers
short again, another cut from Zaheer, and there is absolutely no protection past short third man. Four to Zaheer.
another short ball, Zaheer stays back and punches into the off side
this time Zaheer gets a single, tapped with the spin to the off side
Yusuf drives a full ball on middle and leg down the ground for one
flat outside off and turning into Yusuf who defends
Yusuf moves across, this one was sliding down the leg side and gloves it away fine for four
hint of turn into Yusuf who works it with the spin to the leg side
tossed up on off, Zaheer reaches across and defends
extra bounce outside off, Zaheer stays back and plays inside the line
lifter outside off, Yusuf tries to punch off the back foot, but the bounce overwhelms his shot
here comes the bouncer, Yusuf sees it go through as he weaves away
back of a length outside off, Yusuf stays on the back foot and forces it through point for a single
Zaheer does what he's been doing all series against the fast bowlers - he backs away to leg stump and swings like there is no tomorrow. Most often - like now - he has not made contact

Bouncer aimed at the head, he does not try to get out of the way. He instead tries to swat-pull it when it is almost onto him, without getting into position and it balloons up behind the keeper. Morne runs back and takes it. But wait - the replays show it is a no-ball from Morne. Zaheer survives.
another bouncer, at 144 kph, another mad move-away-and-swipe from Zaheer. Outside edge, goes away behind point for a single
back of a length outside off, stays a touch low as Yusuf looks to cut. Through to AB
turns in sharply from outside off, Zaheer stays back and defends
slider down the leg side, Zaheer gets something on it away for a leg bye
over-pitched outside off and Yusuf drills it stragiht back and very hard. Botha stops it and is happy to still have all the fingers
looks to stay back and late cut past short third man. Can't find the gap and Botha appeals, thinking it was pad first.
paddles this one away with the spin for a single through square leg
Zaheer defends the last ball carefully to the off side

boy, how hard does this man really hit the ball? Yusuf goes for the pull, goes so hard at it, that the fact that he did not middle it had no impact. Lopsy thought he had a chance at deep square leg, and in most cases he would have been. But Yusuf's incredible power rendered him redundant this time
very full on off, Yusuf drives down to long off for a single
Zaheer hangs well back in the crease and fishes at a short delivery outside off. Morne appeals for caught behind, but no one else was interested.
he stays in the crease again and steers him backward of point for a single

Yusuf reaches fifty with the sort of free-spirited smash that typifies his batting. Make no mistake, this has been a good knock - he has blocked well and picked the ones he wanted to go after. This was well outside off and short enough for the sliced cut over point. He timed it well and it beat the fielder at third man easily

Yusuf has the best piece of willow in business! 147 kph, scorching bouncer aimed at his head. Yusuf was completely beaten for pace and so late on the pull that it went well in front of square. Yet it went for four. He didn't seem to be in control at all. Yet got four for it.
turns away from Zaheer, who opens the face and defends to the off side
another one turning away from Zak who defends carefully
similar line, defended cautiously
he comes out of the crease this time and looks to turn it to the leg side, but is beaten by the turn. Stifled appeal for lbw, turned down
this time he gets the single, works it off the pads through square leg for one

right, Yusuf is hitting everything now. Pity, India don't have batsmen at the other end. Tossed up outside off, Yusuf gets into position and rocket-launches it over wide long off. That flew miles over the boundary and has prompted Smith to bring Steyn back on.
short and wide outside off, Zaheer has a flay at it and picks a single to third man. Over to Yusuf again.
slower ball at 117 kph, well bowled by Steyn. Pathan did not pick it straight away, went for the pull and did not time it too well. Single to deep midwicket
bouncer outside off, Zaheer weaves away.
slower ball, 125 kph outside off and Zaheer lets it go after thinking of having a go
Zaheer looks for the big booming cover drive, but can't beat the man inside the circle
another clear-the-feet-and-have-a-heave from Zaheer outside off. Big swish, big miss as he whizzes through to AB.
slides this down the leg and away for four. Five runs to the cause.
flat on the pads, Yusuf defends to the leg side.
short ball, comes in with the arm, Yusuf nudges it through square leg for two
Yusuf comes across the stumps and looks to work it to the leg side, but can't get it away
down the track now and then he defends since it is not there for the loft.
anti-climactic end to the over. Yusuf looks to sweep now and doesn't get it past short fine leg
fast and straight from Steyn, Zaheer gets behind the line for a change and defends
Zaheer gets a French cut past the stumps and wide of AB for a single to fine leg. Over to Yusuf again.
camps on the back foot and looks to carve a full and fast ball outside off through the off side, but he's completely beaten for pace
147.4 kph, this is real pacy and great lines to go with it. Back of a length on off stump and even a rampant Yusuf can't do anything with it.
even as I say it, Steyn loses his line. Full toss on the pads, Yusuf gets some bat on it and it scorches the turf on its way to the fine leg boundary. India somehow manage to keep going.
148.5kph. I think that's the fastest he's bowled today. Short ball, hustled Yusuf into a fend-pull that he was extremely late on. It hit his body and went away towards short third man
turns in from outside off, Yusuf defends to the off side and gets one
Zaheer dabs carefully to the off side, can't beat point
Zaheer moves to the off stump and nudges it square for a single. Back to Yusuf now.

go retrieve that from the stands at midwicket. Yusuf doesn't require elevation. He's latched on to a short ball early and smashed it with cartoonish violence over deep midwicket. That hardly took off, but boy it traveled.

this game is not over. Another full ball from Botha, Yusuf gets under it and bashes this one over long on. Mighty big hitting. Call your friends, ask them to log back in. This is not over, not yet. at least.

fired in short at 96 kph, and Yusuf manages to get it away fine towards third man, despite the extra bounce outside off. A couple more. There is a buzz in the ground. India are still hopelessly behind, but people are now watching the match again.
slower ball on middle and off, Zaheer gets an inside edge behind square leg and Yusuf has strike.

Six. Six. Six. Yusuf has launched Lopsy over long on. How is he timing these?? This was not full enough for the loft either. Yusuf just went through with the drive, extending his arms with great fury and going airborne. It seemed like he could not have got enough meat on that. But it still landed miles behind the boundary. How??
back of a length, slower ball at 120.6 kph. Yusuf can't do much with it.

and now the smarts. SA have set the field straight and have third man and fine leg inside the circle. What does Yusuf do, he moves across to off stump to a short ball, goes down on both knees and back-hand's it with the top hand through fine leg for four. He's close to 100 now!

BRUTAL! Yusuf has 100. Off 68 balls. And he was defending several balls to begin with! Boy, what a whack this one was. Short ball from Lopsy, angling into the body. Yusuf times the pull so well, it seemed to be going up even when it crossed the boundary. It then landed a few miles back. What hitting!

and now some luck to go with it. Full delivery outside off, he looks for the flay over the covers and gets a thick outside edge. It flies in a hurry past short third man. South Africa have reason to be very worried here.
Zaheer does his bit. Short ball outside off, he stays back and cuts it carefully into the outfield. He may be starting to play properly now.

and it's over. Well. It was too good to last. Yusuf looks to rocket-launch it down the ground. And for once, he did not middle it. I think he got it low on the bat and scooped it straight up. Faf gets under the skier. Fittingly, Morne has got the wicket, which I think should clinch the game for SA. Yusuf knew it as soon as he made contact. He was in agony the moment the ball wen up. He was livid before it came down. He was in despair when it was caught. Never mind it, he is a hero.
Zaheer backs away and defends a back of length ball with a straight bat into the covers.
another shortish ball angled into the body. Zaheer fends to the leg side
and he backs away and looks to swipe again. Technically, India can do it in singles. Just saying.
Zaheer backs away and works it off the toes to the leg side for a single
drives into the covers, but can't get the gap
Zaheer keeps rolling. He's seeing it well now, makes room outside off and carves a 144 kph deliver outside off over cover-point for four
pure pace. 145.6 kph bouncer aimed at the body, Zaheer still tries to pull, but can't make contact
full and wide outside off, Zaheer has a feel but is again beaten for pace.
slower ball outside off, 125 kph and Zaheer lets it go
short ball, Zaheer goes for the pull and bottom-edges it towards mid on
Munaf turns the strike over now. Backs away to a short ball and fends it to the leg side. They run across in a hurry for one
short ball, Zaheer backs away and times the pull well, but Lopsy has protection at deep midwicket
Munaf keeps his cool once again, backs away and steers behind point for another single
back of a length outside off, Zaheer fends it with an opened face to short third man.

Incredibly, this match is still not over. Zaheer pulls superbly, great timing and great placement between Botha running back from mid on and Botha from mid on. Both of them pile up as they slide into the boundary, but the ball beats them to it
full and just outside off, Zaheer looks to steer and misses.
fast and furious from Steyn, 147 kph and aimed at the stumps, Munaf backs away and plays it to covers
another short ball, follows Munf "Moving Target" Patel who is backing away. Completely beaten for pace.
and now the yorker, hits the toes but well down the leg side.
Munaf plays his own version of the late cut. Backs away and somehow manages to guide a Steyn thunderbolt to third man
slower ball outside off, 102 kph and Zaheer opens the face to guide it. Does well, but finds short third man
defends a straight ball down the track. SA have only two overs from Steyn-Morkel left today.
tossed up on leg, Munaf paddles away with the top hand and gets a single.
again on middle and leg, Zaheer comes across to try and work to the leg side, but can't get the single
tossed up on off, Zaheer smothers the spin with a nice forward lunge
shortens the length and Zaheer has to adjust after coming down the track. He waits and then defends to the off side
Munaf looks to sweep and misses. Another ball he survives.
it was nearly all over there. It hurried through from outside off as he looked for the steer. Inside edge flew close to leg stump, but missed.
short ball from over the wicket, Zaheer backs away and looks to manufacture a run to the leg side

Could not have been more fitting. Morne Morkel has the last touch on the ball as the series closes. 3-2 to South Africa, who were the better team through the series. Back of a length from Lopsy, Zaheer tries to crack it over the off side, hits it too high and Morne gets under it as he runs to his left from long off.
